Content-Type: text/plain; charset="US-ASCII"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

I'm back all! 
I must say I had a GREAT time! I will give a full report on OTFCC some time 
this week. TONS of stuff happened that should never be left out. 
Plus.. I would STRONGLY urge you to either attend OTFCC in Chicago, IL in 
July 2004 or the very last real BotCon in Pasadena, CA in June of 2004. Glen 
Hallit promises to make OTFCC THE best, & has it planned to run 3 days! So far he 
has planned a mystery dinner for Friday night with the theme of "Who shot 
Optimus Prime?", skits, much of what has been in the past conventions & SO much 
more. Currently a lot is in the works. 

Anyway... I must say briefly, that it was a fantastic convention. I truly had 
the time of my life. The voice actors are very interactive, even at the party 
Saturday night thrown by Allspark.com & Transfandom.com they showed up! Their 
performance in the live script reading was beyond fantastic, it was 
spectacular & full of laughs. All 3 actors - Greg Berger, Garry Chalk & David Kaye - 
were always around somewhere & guaranteed you always had a chance to speak with 
them if only to say "hi" & shake their hand or an autograph. The same applied 
to Vince DiCola & Simon Furmon who were always around & interacted well, 
available to sign autographs & chat. I got pictures with all the actors & with 
Vince DiCola. I didn't get one with Simon Furmon, but.. I would imagine that yes, 
next year that will be a major possiblity. 
Friday night, after the supper was rather fun for fans besides searching for 
parts, as there was a lightsaber battle which I & Jive (Katherine) started. 
Jive has footage of this which several people already asked for copies. :) This 
made us both so excited & this is something that we hope to do again next 
year.
The toys some people were disappointed in. But, I can't say that I am. The 
toys ended up to be Transformers Universe Sideswipe & 2 femmes - sisters - 
Autobot Roulette & Decepticon Shadow Striker. The hotel exclusive was Sunstreaker. 
Now, Sunstreaker & Sideswipe were not like the original Gen 1 style, in fact a 
different style which looks somewhat like RiD or Armada. The t-shirt was 
rather neat though some people didn't particularly think it was spectacular. 
However, I thought it was rather nice. 
Anyway... i figured I give you a taste of OTFCC 2003. Again, I will do a FULL 
report WITH pictures (Hopefully) by the end of the weekend. 
Ciao!
Stac

--part1_1e0.e14e082.2c575efe_boundary
